title: Fire Degree Extraction - Recipes 11-90
methodology: Derived from method field, material_class, and German source keywords

fire_degree_scale.1: Gentle fire, balneum mariae (water bath), delicate materials
fire_degree_scale.3: Strong fire, per alembicum, harder materials (roots, bark, resins)

recipes.name: Alrunen (mandrake)
recipes.reasoning: herb+root, standard distillation - POUND then distill

recipes.name: Angelica
recipes.reasoning: no explicit procedure, standard herb - default degree 2

recipes.name: Abbis (scabious)
recipes.reasoning: herb+flowers+root+stem, CHOP+POUND then distill - comprehensive prep

recipes.name: Atzeln (magpie)
recipes.reasoning: ANIMAL - young birds, distilled in kettles (gkessern), not balneum mariae

recipes.name: Antrechen Blut (duck blood)
recipes.reasoning: ANIMAL blood - explicit balneum mariae in glass (in einem glase im balneum marie)

recipes.name: Burretsch krut (borage herb)
recipes.reasoning: root+herb, CHOP+POUND, standard distillation when flowering

recipes.name: Burretsch blumen (borage flower)
recipes.reasoning: flower tips only - explicit balneum mariae (gedistilliert im balneum marie)

recipes.name: Bulsen krut (henbane)
recipes.reasoning: herb+root, POUND together, standard distillation - stupefactive herb

recipes.name: Blow gilgen (blue iris flower)
recipes.reasoning: no explicit procedure - flower water, default degree 2

recipes.name: Blow gilgen wurtzel (blue iris root)
recipes.reasoning: ROOT only - finely chopped, standard distillation, March timing

recipes.name: Blow gilgen blumlin (blue iris stamen)
recipes.reasoning: delicate flower part - explicit balneum mariae (sunderlich gedistilliert p balneum marie)

recipes.name: Byrcken loub (birch leaf)
recipes.reasoning: youngest leaves, CHOP+POUND, standard distillation

recipes.name: Byrckin safft (birch sap)
recipes.reasoning: sap collection then per alembicum distillation - moderate heat

recipes.name: Burtzeln (purslane)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem+leaves, chopped together, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bibinellen (burnet saxifrage)
recipes.reasoning: herb+sharp root, CHOP+POUND, standard distillation

recipes.name: Beyn holtzin loub (dogwood leaf)
recipes.reasoning: leaves from current year shoots, STRIP then distill

recipes.name: Beyn holtzin blut (dogwood flower)
recipes.reasoning: flowers, standard distillation in June

recipes.name: Brun kressen (watercress)
recipes.reasoning: top portions, BREAK+CHOP, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bachmuntz (water mint)
recipes.reasoning: upper parts+stem+leaves, chopped, standard distillation

recipes.name: Brant latich (burnt lettuce)
recipes.reasoning: no explicit procedure - herb, default degree 2

recipes.name: Bonen blugot (bean flower)
recipes.reasoning: flowers only - explicit balneum mariae (gedistilliert werden in balneo marie)

recipes.name: Bonen (bean whole)
recipes.reasoning: green beans - ventre equino (horse dung heat) - very gentle long-term heat

recipes.name: Bon hulsen (bean pod)
recipes.reasoning: pods, standard distillation with astrological timing

recipes.name: Bonen krut (bean herb)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Gross basilig (large basil)
recipes.reasoning: leaves+stem when flowering, standard distillation

recipes.name: Krusen basilie (curly basil)
recipes.reasoning: stem+leaves, chopped - explicit balneum mariae in June

recipes.name: Blow meyblumen (blue may flower)
recipes.reasoning: flowers, standard distillation in May

recipes.name: Bocks blut (goat blood)
recipes.reasoning: ANIMAL blood from uncastrated buck - standard distillation (not balneum)

recipes.name: Butten laub (rose hip leaf)
recipes.reasoning: leaves stripped when strongest taste, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bathonien (betony)
recipes.reasoning: leaves+stem, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Buchin loub (beech leaf)
recipes.reasoning: leaves stripped from branches, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bocksbart (goat's beard)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem WITHOUT root, chopped, standard distillation in June

recipes.name: Bromber (blackberry)
recipes.reasoning: ripe berries, washed, standard distillation

recipes.name: Boley (pennyroyal)
recipes.reasoning: whole herb, chopped when flowering, standard distillation

recipes.name: Blow violen (blue violet)
recipes.reasoning: flowers preferred, per alembicum in March - moderate heat

recipes.name: Bucken (mugwort)
recipes.reasoning: leaves+flower clusters, stripped, standard distillation

recipes.name: Breit wegrich (broadleaf plantain)
recipes.reasoning: procedure corrupted - herb, default degree 2

recipes.name: Breit wegrich samen (plantain seed)
recipes.reasoning: seed, standard distillation when ripe

recipes.name: Breit wegrich blut (plantain bloom)
recipes.reasoning: flowering spike+stem, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bendicten krut (herb bennet)
recipes.reasoning: root+herb, WASH+CHOP, standard distillation end of March

recipes.name: Bestennaw (parsnip)
recipes.reasoning: ROOT only (explicitly NOT herb), chopped, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bappeln (mallow)
recipes.reasoning: root+stem, WASH+CHOP, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bappeln blut (mallow bloom)
recipes.reasoning: blooms from SMALL mallow, standard distillation

recipes.name: Brunellen (self-heal)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem+flowers, chopped, standard distillation

recipes.name: Bingel krut (mercury herb)
recipes.reasoning: herb+root, standard distillation beginning June - END OF CHAPTER B

recipes.name: Camillen (chamomile)
recipes.reasoning: herb+flowers, chopped, standard distillation in June

recipes.name: Cardus benedictus (blessed thistle)
recipes.reasoning: leaves only, chopped, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Cliben (bedstraw)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem+leaves, chopped, standard distillation

recipes.name: Crutz wurtz (crosswort)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem+flowers, chopped, standard distillation in June

recipes.name: Clein brennende nessel (small nettle)
recipes.reasoning: herb WITHOUT root, CHOP+POUND, standard distillation mid-June

recipes.name: Cabs krut (cabbage)
recipes.reasoning: leaves broken from stalks, standard distillation end of June

recipes.name: Dusent guldin krut (centaury)
recipes.reasoning: stem+leaves+flowers, chopped, standard distillation end of June

recipes.name: Duben kropff (fumitory)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem, chopped, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Denmarck (valerian)
recipes.reasoning: root+herb+stem, chopped, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Dudistel (sow thistle)
recipes.reasoning: leaves+stem, chopped, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Ertber (strawberry)
recipes.reasoning: fruit - rose hood distillation (like rose water), with/without fire options

recipes.name: Encian (gentian)
recipes.reasoning: ROOT preferably alone, chopped - end of dog days timing for root

recipes.name: Eschyn boum bletter (ash tree leaves)
recipes.reasoning: leaf clusters, POUND with VINEGAR, steep 5-6 days, then distill

recipes.name: Fenchel (fennel)
recipes.reasoning: herb OR root - herb end May, root end dog days - default 2

recipes.name: Fedistel (milk thistle)
recipes.reasoning: leaves broken from stalks, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Filipendel (dropwort)
recipes.reasoning: herb+root, chopped together, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Freissam krut (pansy)
recipes.reasoning: cultivated herb+stem+flowers, standard distillation when flowering

recipes.name: Funffinger krut (cinquefoil)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem+root, chopped, standard distillation mid-May

recipes.name: Guldin gunsel (golden bugle)
recipes.reasoning: herb+flowers+stem, standard distillation mid-May

recipes.name: Gross gunsel (large bugle)
recipes.reasoning: whole herb, standard distillation in June

recipes.name: Gamander (germander)
recipes.reasoning: whole plant, chopped, standard distillation mid-May

recipes.name: Genserich (silverweed)
recipes.reasoning: root+herb, chopped, distilled between Lady Days (Aug-Sep)

recipes.name: Genserich blumen (silverweed flowers)
recipes.reasoning: flowers at full ripeness, explicit per alembicum

recipes.name: Gundreb (ground ivy)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem, chopped, standard distillation beginning June

recipes.name: Gel violen (wallflower)
recipes.reasoning: flower umbels/tops at full ripeness, standard distillation near end May

recipes.name: Garben (yarrow)
recipes.reasoning: OCR corrupted - herb, default degree 2

recipes.name: Guldin cle (golden clover)
recipes.reasoning: leaves only, standard distillation mid-May

recipes.name: Gel gilgen (yellow iris)
recipes.reasoning: flowers at peak ripeness, standard distillation

recipes.name: Garten kress (garden cress)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Harn krut (toadflax)
recipes.reasoning: herb+stem, chopped, standard distillation end of May

recipes.name: Holder rind (elder bark)
recipes.reasoning: middle green bark - explicit per alembicum in balneum mariae

recipes.name: Holder bletter (elder leaves)
recipes.reasoning: tender tips+umbels+leaves, chopped, standard distillation mid-May

recipes.name: Holder blut (elder flowers)
recipes.reasoning: flowers stripped from stems at full ripeness, standard distillation

recipes.name: Hunds zung (hound's tongue)
recipes.reasoning: herb+leaves+stem+flowers+root, chopped, standard distillation end June

recipes.name: Hyrtz zung (hart's tongue fern)
recipes.reasoning: leaves only (fern), standard distillation in May

notes: Degree 1 assigned for explicit balneum mariae or very gentle heat methods
Degree 2 is default for standard herb distillation (gebrant/gedistilliert)
Degree 3 assigned for root-only preparations or explicitly strong materials
Animal products vary: blood usually balneum mariae (1), whole animals usually standard (2)
